title: [Large-scale] Online Learning Program Based on Communities of Practice (CoP) for Pre-Service Teachers' Professional Development

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic teaching-learning theories and elementary educational environments
context.additional_context: Emphasis on practical educational experiences based on sociocultural learning theory. Construction of collaborative learning environments using digital devices.

learning_goals: Enhance collaborative problem-solving competencies among pre-service teachers through community of practice activities

Learners will establish 3 practical strategies for field adaptability and 2 action plans for professional development through monthly 1-hour mentoring sessions with mentor teachers, and submit a report meeting ≥4 of 5 evaluation rubric items by course completion.

Learners will perform 3 project-based assessments (lesson design, student evaluation, class management simulation) over 6 months, achieving an average of ≥4 points on a 5-point rubric scale per project to demonstrate teaching competencies.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
